title: Ministry hails pact with Spanish club
summary:
The Ministry of Tourism has said its six months agreement with Spanish second-tier football league outfit Club Deportivo Leganés, as part of a strategy to expand Malawi’s brand awareness, was a success.

The Ministry of Tourism has said its six months agreement with Spanish second-tier football league outfit Club Deportivo Leganés, as part of a strategy to expand Malawi’s brand awareness, was a success.

The agreement, which was signed in January 2023, meant the team wore kits bearing the “Malawi, The Warm Heart of Africa” logo

title: Stock exchange in slow February start
summary:
The equity market opened February on a subdued note, with major indices edging lower despite pockets of buying at selected counters.

Investors took a cautious stance at the start of the new trading month.

title: Malawi to reap from $3.9m AfDB support
summary:
Malawi is among 13 African countries that are set to benefit from a new $3.9 million African Development Bank (AfDB) technical assistance project.

title: Airtel Africa post-tax profit grows to $586m
summary:
Post-tax-profit for Airtel Africa more than doubled to $586 million in the nine-month period to December 31, 2025, up from $248 million in the prior period.

Post-tax-profit for Airtel Africa more than doubled to $586 million in the nine-month period to December 31, 2025, up from $248 million in the prior period.

title: Portland production up, to cut imports bill
summary: Port­land Cement Malawi Lim­ited has increased its cement pro­duc­tion to 70 per­cent capa­city, a devel­op­ment that is expec­ted to save the coun­try more than $30 mil­lion annu­ally by redu­cing reli­ance on impor­ted cement. title: Tobacco Demand Drops, Raising Concerns for Farmers and the Economy
summary:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also fal...
text_preview:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also falling—from 11 last year to 8 this year. Experts warn that fewer buyers could push prices down, which ...

title: APM Delivers: Over 100,000 Tonnes of Maize from Zambia Begin Arriving in Malawi
summary:
President Peter Mutharika is keeping his promise to fight hunger in Malawi as the first batch of 103,000 metric tonnes of maize—part of the 200,000MT procured from Zambia—begins entering the country through the Mchinji-Mwami border.

Both local and international transporters are moving the maize fro...
text_preview:
President Peter Mutharika is keeping his promise to fight hunger in Malawi as the first batch of 103,000 metric tonnes of maize—part of the 200,000MT procured from Zambia—begins entering the country through the Mchinji-Mwami border.

Both local and international transporters are moving the maize from Zambia’s Food Reserve Agency silos in Chipata to Malawi’s National Food Reserve Agency in Lilongwe...
